conclusion: Determine the minimum area of paper to cover each face of the cube to hide the bubble.
Use the concept of total internal reflection for calculations.
Calculate critical angle C using sin(C) = 1/n = 2/3, so C = arcsin(2/3).
The bubble is at the center of the cube with side length a.
Determine the radius r of the circle on the cube's face using sin(C) = (a/2)/r.
Calculate the area A of the circular region: A = πr^2 = 9πa^2/16.
Minimum area of each piece of paper is 9πa^2/16.
